prompt: Please write out the expression of the formula in the image using LaTeX format.
text:
The image shows a formula written in a non-standard notation, which can be rewritten in LaTeX format as follows:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Expression} & = \frac{1}{3} x^2 + \frac{1}{3} y^2 \\
& = \frac{1}{3} \left(x+y\right)^2 \\
& = \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+2xy+y^2\right) \\
& = \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+2xy+y^2\right) - \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+y^2\right) \\
& = \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+2xy+y^2\right) - \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+y^2\right) - \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+y^2\right) \\
& = \frac{1}{3} \left(x^2+2xy+y^2\right) - \frac{2}{3} \left(x^2+y^2\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

This expression represents the area of a triangle formed by the points $(x, y)$, $(x, 0)$, and $(0, y)$.
